content:
Here is a tweet about an upcoming talk by Alessandro Tagliabue. The talk's title is Manganese limitation of Southern Ocean phytoplankton. The talk is this coming Tuesday 19th Jan at 1600 GMT = 0900 MST and viewable via zoom.

I saw him give an excellent talk on this topic earlier this week in a conference. He is a really good speaker.

2021 U.S. Northeast Climate-Fisheries Seminar Series
2021_US_Northeast_Climate_Fisheries_Seminars.pdf

Applications of machine learning to Argo biogeochemical floats
Rosalind Echols, UW School of Oceanography
Feb 9, 12:30 P.M. (I think), via Zoom
(no abstract provided)

I came across this talk at
https://www.onlineresearchseminars.org/?k=&s=&topic=3&subtopic=23
which has links to lots of wonderful looking talks.
It looks like this site is a good recipe for getting no work done. :slight_smile:
